dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: ...so Vienna, apparently, is the best city to live in the world, according to this new index. Vienna? Really? Like, what even is this index measuring? How can you quantify 'best'?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...so Vienna, apparently, is the best city to live in the world, according to this new index. Vienna? Really? Like, what even is this index measuring? How can you quantify 'best'?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best city to live was Vienna, Austria.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: It's the Global Liveability Index. They, uh, look at security, education, healthcare, infrastructure...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's the Global Liveability Index. They, uh, look at security, education, healthcare, infrastructure...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Global Liveability Index compares world cities with each other in terms of security, affordability, education, healthcare, its urban lifestyle and infrastructure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: And I'm guessing no US cities made the top ten, then. Because, you know, 'security' and 'infrastructure' in the US.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And I'm guessing no U S cities made the top ten, then. Because, you know, 'security' and 'infrastructure' in the U S.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Global Liveability Index, a measurement of the world's best cities to call home, not a single U.S. city was good enough to make the cut.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: You'd be right. Zero US cities in the top ten. Canada had three: Calgary, Vancouver, Toronto.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You'd be right. Zero U S cities in the top ten. Canada had three: Calgary, Vancouver, Toronto.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Canada had three cities, by comparison, including Calgary (3), Vancouver (6) and Toronto (7).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, Canada. Of course. Because they're just so, like, perfectly... inoffensive. Honolulu is our best at forty-seven, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, Canada. Of course. Because they're just so, like, perfectly... inoffensive. Honolulu is our best at forty-seven, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best American city on a global scale was Honolulu.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Honolulu at 47. But they say it's not that US cities are getting worse. It's that, um, others are just getting better in comparison.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Honolulu at forty seven. But they say it's not that U S cities are getting worse. It's that, um, others are just getting better in comparison.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That doesn't necessarily mean that U.S. cities are getting worse. It just means that other cities on the scale are getting better compared to one another.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Or maybe they are getting worse, and this report just can't say it. Sounds like an excuse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or maybe they are getting worse, and this report just can't say it. Sounds like an excuse.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they do note that global political instability and economic uncertainty impacted rankings. So, the world's a mess, but Vienna's still perfect? Seems, uh, a little too convenient.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they do note that global political instability and economic uncertainty impacted rankings. So, the world's a mess, but Vienna's still perfect? Seems, uh, a little too convenient.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: They also say the top cities tend to be midsize, in wealthy countries, with low population density.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They also say the top cities tend to be midsize, in wealthy countries, with low population density.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Those that score best tend to be midsize cities in wealthier countries. Several cities in the top 10 also have relatively low population density.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: So, not New York, not London, not Paris. Which, like, is anyone actually surprised by that? New York is 57th, London 48th. High cost of living, overburdened infrastructure, higher crime.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, not New York, not London, not Paris. Which, like, is anyone actually surprised by that? New York is fifty seventh, London forty eighth. High cost of living, overburdened infrastructure, higher crime.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: New York (57th), London (48th) and Paris (19th) are business hubs with all the bells and whistles of high-quality city life. But each one has higher levels of crime and congestion that make them much less liveable than their peers in the top 10.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Right. All the things that make a city less livable. So this index just, uh, confirms the obvious, but with a number.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. All the things that make a city less livable. So this index just, uh, confirms the obvious, but with a number.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: It, um, provides context. Like, Rio de Janeiro ranks higher than São Paulo, surprisingly, despite its violent crime issues.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It, um, provides context. Like, Rio de Janeiro ranks higher than São Paulo, surprisingly, despite its violent crime issues.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rio de Janeiro (88) ranks higher than São Paulo (93), which is surprising given its massive problem with violent crime.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Wait. Violent crime doesn't disqualify you if you have, what, better weather? What kind of metric is that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait. Violent crime doesn't disqualify you if you have, what, better weather? What kind of metric is that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: They said it's the compactness, better cultural attractions, and less congestion than São Paulo, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They said it's the compactness, better cultural attractions, and less congestion than São Paulo, actually.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The general compactness of the city, and an overall better offering of cultural attractions and climate make it better than the less violent, but too big, too congested, and too wet São Paulo.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: So, if your city's a chaotic mess, just call it 'compact' and 'culturally rich', and you're good. Got it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, if your city's a chaotic mess, just call it 'compact' and 'culturally rich', and you're good. Got it.
